property.name: nupic.opf.claClassifier.implementation
property.description: The classifier implementation to use by default. The current options are 'py', 'cpp', and 'diff'.

property.name: nupic.opf.metricWindow
property.description: The number of records over which average metrics (eror, Grok Score, etc.) are computed. Must be greater than 1.

property.name: nupic.model.temporalAnomaly.wait_records
property.description: The number of records to wait before classification begins. Used to wait for anomaly scores to settle down before classifying anomalies.

property.name: nupic.model.temporalAnomaly.auto_detect_threshold
property.description: Threshold on the anomaly score used to identify anomalies. Anomaly score ranges are between 0 and 1. If this value is set above 1, it is the equivalent of turning auto classification off.

property.name: nupic.model.temporalAnomaly.window_length
property.description: The number of records back to store relevent information for anomaly classification. These records will be recalculated when labels or thresholds are updated.

property.name: nupic.model.temporalAnomaly.anomaly_vector
property.description: Vector type used to classify anomalies. Types: tpc - classify on active cells in the TP sp_tpe - classify on the active SP columns concatenated with the predicted TP columns that did not become active

property.name: nupic.cluster.database.host
property.description: Name of the machine running the MySQL database server

property.name: nupic.cluster.database.user
property.description: Username for the MySQL database server

property.name: nupic.cluster.database.port
property.description: Port number for the MySQL database server

property.name: nupic.cluster.database.passwd
property.description: Password for the MySQL database server

property.name: nupic.cluster.database.nameSuffix
property.description: Suffix to place at the end of each database name.

property.name: nupic.model.checkpoint.maxPredictionRows
property.description: Maximum number of prediction rows to save along with model checkpoints.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.minParticlesPerSwarm
property.description: The minimum number of particles to create per swarm

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.speculative.particles.default
property.description: If true (not 0), hypersearch workers will go ahead and create and run particles in subsequent sprints and generations before the current generation or sprint has been completed. If false, a worker will wait in a sleep loop until the current generation or sprint has finished before choosing the next particle position or going into the next sprint. When true, the best model can be found faster, but results are less repeatable due to the randomness of when each worker completes each particle. This property can be overridden via the speculativeParticles element of the Hypersearch job params.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.max.field.branching
property.description: If > 0 at every sprint only the top n fields from the pair sprint will be appended to the best model from the previous sprint. Usefull feature for datasets with many fields. Also limits the maximum number of fields that can be in the best model to this n.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.min.field.contribution
property.description: When adding fields in sprints only looks at fields that by themselves contribute at least by n percent to improving the error

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.speculative.particles.sleepSecondsMax
property.description: When a worker sleeps to honor nupic.hypersearch.speculative.particles, it will sleep for a random amount of time between 0 and this value.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maxUniqueModelAttempts
property.description: The max # of attempts we will make to create a unique model before giving up and assuming all the possible positions in a swarm have been evaluated.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.modelOrphanIntervalSecs
property.description: The max amount of time (in seconds) allowed before a model is considered orphaned. At this point, it is available for being taken over by another worker.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maxPctErrModels
property.description: If this percent of the models in a hyperseach completed with an error, abort the search.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.inertia
property.description: Weight given to the previous velocity of a particle in PSO.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.cogRate
property.description: This parameter controls how much the particle is affected by its distance from it's local best position.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.socRate
property.description: This parameter controls how much the particle is affected by its distance from the global best position.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.randomUpperBound
property.description: Upper bound for sampling a random number in the PSO.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.randomLowerBound
property.description: Lower bound for sampling a random number in the PSO.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.bestModelMinRecords
property.description: The minimum number of records for a model to be a candidate for the 'best model' in a hypersearch job

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.enableModelMaturity
property.description: Feature flag to enable model maturity. If set to 1, models can be stopped early if their error scores level off. Otherwise, all models will run till they are killed or until they run out of data

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maturityNumPoints
property.description: The number of points that model runner looks at to determine if the model has matured. For example, if set to 10, the model runner will look at the change over the LAST 10 points to see if the model has matured

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maturityPctChange
property.description: Model maturity is determined by the averege percent change error over time. This sets the maximum percent change (positive or negative) that a model can have and still be considered 'mature'.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.enableSwarmTermination
property.description: Feature flag to enable swarm early termination. If set to 1, poorly performing swarms (field combinations) will killed before the swarm reaches maturation. 'Poor performance' is defined relative to other swarms in the hypersearch

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.swarmMaturityWindow
property.description: If the best model for a swarm has remained unchanged for this many generations, the swarm is considered mature.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.swarmMaxGenerations
property.description: The maximum number of generations a swarm (pso optimization) can evolve before it is considered mature. Set to -1 to indicate infinite generations.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.minWorkersPerSwarm
property.description: The minimum workers to allocate per swarm.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maxWorkersPerSwarm
property.description: The maximum workers to allocate per swarm. Set to 0 to fall back to "nupic.scheduler.default.maxSlotsPerJob".

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.ensemble
property.description: If 1, predictions from every model are saved in hbase.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.minWorkersPerEnsemble
property.description: The minimum workers to allocate per ensemble.

property.name: nupic.hypersearch.maxWorkersPerEnsemble
property.description: The maximum workers to allocate for an ensemble.
